sense.def:
To stir a liquid
pomeni z nečim mešati tekočino v posodi, na primer z žlico.

seg.quote: The tourist was stirring his coffee and gazing at the buildings.

sense.def:
To stir
pomeni rahlo se premakniti, na primer zato, ker nam je neudobno.

seg.quote: Etta didn't stir, pretending to be asleep.

sense.def:
Kadar veter
stirs an object
, rahlo premakne neki predmet.

seg.quote: A stray breath of wind stirred the stillness of the robes.

sense.def:
To stir oneself
pomeni premakniti se, da bi nekaj naredili.

seg.quote: Finally, one of the males stirred himself and took a step forward.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
stirs someone
, povzroči, da se človek čustveno odzove, ker je zelo lepo ali ganljivo.

seg.quote: There was a particular passage which always stirred him profoundly.

sense.def:
Kadar neki dogodek
causes a stir
, povzroči veliko vznemirjenje, šok ali jezo.

seg.quote: Her speech created a huge stir.

sense.def:
Kadar določeno razpoloženje, čustvo ali zamisel
stirs in someone
, začne čutiti ali razmišljati o nečem.

seg.quote: The debate was reopened and a new mood was stirring.
Something seemed to stir within her.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
stirs up dust or mud
, povzroči, da se prah ali blato premika.

seg.quote: Some gentle winds stirred up the dust.

sense.def:
To stir up trouble
ali
to stir up a feeling
, pomeni povzročiti težave ali poskrbeti, da ljudje čutijo na določen način.

seg.quote: ...a rally called to stir up popular support for nuclear disarmament.
